newsitem.title: CHINA: China foreign investment seen up 15 pct in 1997.
newsitem.headline: China foreign investment seen up 15 pct in 1997.

text.p: Foreign direct investment in China is expected to reach $49.5 billion in 1997, up 15 percent from last year, the China Securities newspaper said on Wednesday.
More foreign funds would be invested in the less-developed central and western regions of the country, the newspaper quoted a report by the State Information Centre as saying.
The return of Hong Kong to Chinese rule in July would boost the proportion of foreign direct investment coming from Hong Kong and Taiwan, it said.
The amount of foreign funds invested in China's property sector would also grow, it said but gave no further details.
